body:
I'm assuming that the list is supposed to be sorted? If not then the simplest thing to do is to add the new item to the start of the list:

head = new Node(item, head);

If, however, it needs to be sorted then you need to find the first item that is larger than the item you are inserting:

while (!located && current != null) { 
    if (item < current.item) {
        prev = current;
        current = current.link;
    } else {
        located = true;
    }
}

Node newNode = new Node(item, current);
if (current == head) {
    head = newNode;
} else {
    prev.link = newNode; 
}

This code is looking for the point at which the new item needs to be inserted. At that point prev and current reference the nodes before and after the new node. If you get to the end of the list then current is null.
title: How do I finish this method to add a value to a linked list in Java?
